Package dev.efekos.classes.api.i

Interface IModifier

public interface IModifier
Main interface for ModifierRegistry.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    apply(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int level, double value)
    Applies whatever this modifier does to the given player.
    void

    Removes all the effects that this modifier has given to the player.
    String

    Returns a description about this modifier, that must follow the rules below.
    boolean
    isPositive(int level, double value)
    Returns true if this modifier would be a positive thing when applied to a player with the level and value given.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      void apply(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int level, double value)
      Applies whatever this modifier does to the given player. Classes will call this method everytime the player respawns, and when the player joins the class.
      Parameters:
      player - Player that is in a class with this modifier.
      level - Class level of the player. Can be used to boost effects of this modifier.
      value - Value that was given to this modifier specifically for the class that player is in. Should be used as the main value of effects. For example: most of the modifiers added by Classes is an attribute modifier that just changes an attribute of the player. They use this value parameter instead of static values.
      Since:
      1.0

    • deapply

      void deapply(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Removes all the effects that this modifier has given to the player. Classes will call this method when the player leaved his class.
      Parameters:
      player - Player that was in a class with this modifier.
      Since:
      1.0

    • getDescription

      String getDescription(int level, double value)
      Returns a description about this modifier, that must follow the rules below.
      • Description must be yellow (ChatColor.YELLOW) by default.
      This description doesn't have to be a static description, or just a string. I can be changed using the level and value parameters.
      Parameters:
      level - Class level of the player that will see this. If player is not in the class that contains this modifier, then 0.
      value - Value of this modifier in the class that contains this modifier.
      Returns:
      A description for this modifier.
      Since:
      1.0

    • isPositive

      boolean isPositive(int level, double value)
      Returns true if this modifier would be a positive thing when applied to a player with the level and value given.
      Parameters:
      level - Class level of the player that will receive this information.
      value - Value of this modifier that was given by the class that player is in.
      Returns:
      Whether is this modifier positive.
      Since:
      1.0
